Cupcakes, those delightful miniature cakes, have long been a staple of celebrations and casual gatherings alike. Their origins date back to the late 18th and early 19th centuries in the United States, where they were initially favored due to their simple, easy-to-measure ingredients: one cup of butter, two cups of sugar, three cups of flour, and four eggs.

Wedding cakes are traditional centerpieces of weddings, often multi-tiered and elaborately decorated, symbolizing celebration and the unity of marriage. They can be customized in countless ways to reflect the couple's taste and wedding theme, ranging from classic white cakes to modern, flamboyant creations. Couples frequently incorporate unique designs, flavors, and personal touches, making the wedding cake a memorable and personal highlight of their special day.
